title: Mental Health Care: MCA and DoLS
headline: Understand the UK’s Mental Capacity Act and the Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards with this free online course.
description: Mental ability and circumstances influence decisions but those who lack mental capacity require support to make choices. This course examines the Mental Capacity Act (MCA), the Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards (DoLS) and how to deal with individuals who lack this ability. You will also learn how to apply this act during a pandemic. This course is for you if you work in the mental health care sector and want to learn more about MCA and DoLS.
courseDescription:
In 2005, the United Kingdom implemented the Mental Capacity Act (MCA), which established a procedure for acting and making decisions on behalf of persons over sixteen in England and Wales who cannot make specific decisions for themselves. ‘Mental capacity’ refers to a person's ability to make personal judgments but people who lack such capacity require assistance in making particular decisions. This course delves deeply into the Mental Capacity Act, the Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards and the fundamental concepts and obligations of public bodies and services created by the Act.

We begin with an introduction to the mental capacity legislation, the relevant code of practices and its core principles. You will learn what 'best interests' decisions are, how to make them and how to handle a dispute. You will also study the role of independent mental capacity advocates and lasting powers of attorney before reviewing how the MCA relates to social and health care. We will also outline the roles and responsibilities of the court of protection, the deputies appointed by the court and the public guardian.

The last section deals with the Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards (DoLS) and the MCA's guidelines on the subject. Discover the assessment procedures, timescales and standard processes utilised to assess a DoLS authorisation request. You will also examine the application of the MCA and DoLS during a pandemic and the powers held by various bodies and officials. Finally, you will discover the liberty protection safeguards, their essential requirements and how they vary from DoLS. John Academy is the publisher of this course. They provide learners with easy-to-understand study materials. Anybody who works in the mental health care sector and wants to learn more about MCA and DoLS will find this course beneficial.
